column4: Grrr, can anybody help me with this: http://pastebin.ca/208339
ahh, it was you :)
huh?
have you tried apt-get installing one of those unmet dependancies?
i had the link open but couldnt remember who had the problem :P
I think apt should do that by itself right?
I mean, that's what apt is for... :)
yes, somtimes dependancies become brokenthough
yes that's because I removed one line from my sources.list I think
and I have after that apt-get update'd
but it still seems to 'know' something about it though.
try apt-get install php5-common
apt-get remove it, then rerun the original command that you are having the problem with
apt-get remove php5-common
then apt-get install php5-gd
I tried dpkg --purge php5-common but that won't work unless I do a force. When I try to apt-get remove php5-common, it wants to remove a whole slew of other packages.
hmm thats a problem
yes
you can turn it off
I know but I always forget.
personly i like it :)
